sen.j: 秋篠寺（あきしのでら）は、奈良県奈良市秋篠町にある寺院。
sen.e: Akishinodera is a temple which is located in Akishino-cho, Nara City, Nara.
Akishino-dera Temple is a temple which is located in Akishino-cho, Nara City, Nara.
Akishino-dera Temple is a temple which is located in Akishino-cho, Nara City, Nara.

sen.j: 本尊は薬師如来、開基（創立者）は善珠とされている。
sen.e: The principal Buddhist image is Yakushi Nyorai and its founder is said to be Zenshu.
The principal Buddhist image is Yakushi Nyorai and its founder is said to be Zenshu.
The principal Buddhist image is Yakushi Nyorai and its founder is said to be Zenshu.

sen.j: 山号はなし。
sen.e: It has no other name.
It has no other name.
It has no other name.

sen.j: 宗派はもと法相宗、真言宗、浄土宗に属したが現在は単立である。
sen.e: It originally belonged to Hososhu, Shingonshu and Jodoshu, but now is independent.
It originally belonged to Hosso sect, Shingon sect and Jodo sect, but now is independent.
sen.cmt: Hososhu > Hosso sectShingonshu > Shingon sectJodoshu > Jodo sect
sen.e: It originally belonged to Hosso sect, Shingon sect and Jodo sect, but now is independent.

sen.j: 技芸天像と国宝の本堂で知られる。
sen.e: Akishinodera is famous for the statue of Gigeiten and the main hall designated as a national treasure.
Akishino-dera Temple is famous for the statue of Gigeiten and the main hall designated as a national treasure.
Akishino-dera Temple is famous for the statue of Gigeiten and the main hall designated as a national treasure.

sen.j: 奈良市街地の北西、西大寺 (奈良市)の北方に位置する。
sen.e: It is located northwest of Nara urban district and north of Saidaiji (in Nara City).
It is located northwest of Nara urban district and north of Saidai-ji Temple (in Nara City).
It is located northwest of Nara urban district and north of Saidai-ji Temple (in Nara City).

sen.j: 奈良時代の法相宗（南都六宗の1つ）の僧・善珠が創建したとされ、地元の豪族秋篠氏の氏寺とも言われているが、創建の具体的な時期や事情については、たしかなことはわかっていない。
sen.e: They say that Zenshu who was a priest of Hososhu (one of Nantorokushu) founded Akishinodera in the Nara period or that the Akishino clan, a local powerful family, founded it, but its exact founding date and circumstances are not clear.

They say that Zenshu who was a priest of Hososhu (one of Nanto Rokushu (the six sects of Buddhism which flourished in ancient Nara)) founded Akishino-dera Temple in the Nara period or that the Akishino clan, a local powerful family, founded it, but its exact founding date and circumstances are not clear.
sen.cmt: Nantorokushu > Nanto Rokushu (the six sects of Buddhism which flourished in ancient Nara)Akishinodera > Akishino-dera Temple
sen.e: They say that Zenshu who was a priest of Hososhu (one of Nanto Rokushu (the six sects of Buddhism which flourished in ancient Nara)) founded Akishino-dera Temple in the Nara period or that the Akishino clan, a local powerful family, founded it, but its exact founding date and circumstances are not clear.

sen.j: 『続日本紀』に宝亀11年（780年）、光仁天皇が秋篠寺に食封（じきふ）一百戸を施入したとあるのが文献上の初見である（食封とは、一定地域の戸（世帯）から上がる租庸調を給与や寺院の維持費等として支給するもの）。
sen.e: In an article that Emperor Konin donated one hundred jikifu to Akishinodera in 780 in "Shoku Nihongi," Akishinodera appears first in the literature (Jikifu was a salary or a maintaining allowance for temples, and one jikifu was worth taxes levied on one household).

In an article that Emperor Konin donated one hundred jikifu to Akishino-dera Temple in 780 in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Akishino-dera Temple appears first in the literature (Jikifu was a salary or a maintaining allowance for temples, and one jikifu was worth taxes levied on one household).
sen.cmt: 先頭のスペースを削除しました。Akishinodera > Akishino-dera Temple"Shoku Nihongi," > "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued),
sen.e: In an article that Emperor Konin donated one hundred jikifu to Akishino-dera Temple in 780 in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Akishino-dera Temple appears first in the literature (Jikifu was a salary or a maintaining allowance for temples, and one jikifu was worth taxes levied on one household).

sen.j: また、『日本後紀』には大同 (日本)元年（806年）、桓武天皇の五七忌が秋篠寺で行われたことが見え、天皇家とも関連の深い寺院であったと思われる。
sen.e: "Nihon koki" says the Buddhist service of the thirty fifth days after death for Emperor Kanmu was held at Akishinodera and it was apparently deeply related with the imperial family.

"Nihon Koki" (Later Chronicle of Japan) says the Buddhist service of the thirty fifth days after death for Emperor Kanmu was held at Akishino-dera Temple and it was apparently deeply related with the imperial family.
sen.cmt: "Nihon koki" > "Nihon Koki" (Later Chronicle of Japan)Akishinodera > Akishino-dera Temple
sen.e: "Nihon Koki" (Later Chronicle of Japan) says the Buddhist service of the thirty fifth days after death for Emperor Kanmu was held at Akishino-dera Temple and it was apparently deeply related with the imperial family.

sen.j: 秋篠寺は保延元年（1135年）の火災により講堂以外の主要伽藍を焼失した。
sen.e: Main cathedrals except for a lecture hall of Akishinodera was burned down in 1135.
Main cathedrals except for a lecture hall of Akishino-dera Temple was burned down in 1135.
Main cathedrals except for a lecture hall of Akishino-dera Temple was burned down in 1135.

sen.j: 現存する本堂（国宝）は、旧講堂の位置に建つが、創建当時のものではなく、鎌倉時代の再建である。
sen.e: The existing main hall which is located on a place where an old lecture hall was placed was rebuilt in the Kamakura period.
The existing main hall which is located on a place where an old lecture hall was placed was rebuilt in the Kamakura period.
The existing main hall which is located on a place where an old lecture hall was placed was rebuilt in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 宗派は当初の法相宗から真言宗、浄土宗に代わり、現在は単立となっている。
sen.e: It originally belonged to Hososhu, Shingonshu and Jodoshu, but now is independent.
It originally belonged to Hosso sect, Shingon sect and Jodo sect, but now is independent.
sen.cmt: Hososhu > Hosso sectShingonshu > Shingon sectJodoshu > Jodo sect
sen.e: It originally belonged to Hosso sect, Shingon sect and Jodo sect, but now is independent.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 拝観入口は東門になっているが、本来の正門は南門である。
sen.e: An entrance for seeing is the east gate while the main gate is the south gate.
An entrance for seeing is the east gate while the main gate is the south gate.
An entrance for seeing is the east gate while the main gate is the south gate.

sen.j: 南門と本堂の間には、雑木林の中に金堂、東西両塔の跡があり、それぞれ礎石が残っている。
sen.e: There still remain foundation stones, the ruins of the golden hall and the east and west towers, in the wooded area between the south gate and the main hall.
There still remain foundation stones, the ruins of the golden hall and the east and west towers, in the wooded area between the south gate and the main hall.
There still remain foundation stones, the ruins of the golden hall and the east and west towers, in the wooded area between the south gate and the main hall.

tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: -鎌倉時代の建立で、当時の和様建築仏堂の代表作の1つである。
sen.e: This was built in the Kamakura period and is one of representative Japanese-style Buddhist temples at that time.
This was built in the Kamakura period and is one of representative Japanese-style Buddhist temples at that time.
This was built in the Kamakura period and is one of representative Japanese-style Buddhist temples at that time.

sen.j: 屋根は寄棟造、本瓦葺き。
sen.e: It is covered with a hipped, traditional tiled roof.
It is covered with a hipped, traditional tiled roof.
It is covered with a hipped, traditional tiled roof.

sen.j: 堂の周囲には縁などを設けず、内部は床を張らずに土間とする。
sen.e: No veranda is wrapped around it and it has earth floor.
No veranda is wrapped around it and it has doma (dirt floor).
No veranda is wrapped around it and it has doma (dirt floor).

sen.j: 正面の柱間5間にはいずれも開口部（格子戸または窓）を設けている。
sen.e: It has five openings (latticed doors or windows) between pillars in the façade.
It has five openings (latticed doors or windows) between pillars in the façade.
It has five openings (latticed doors or windows) between pillars in the facade.

sen.j: 全体に簡素な構成で、鎌倉時代の再建でありながら奈良時代建築を思わせる様式を示す建物である。
sen.e: Its structure is simple and the building looks architecture in the Nara period although it was rebuilt in the Kamakura period.
Its structure is simple and the building looks architecture in the Nara period although it was rebuilt in the Kamakura period.
Its structure is simple and the building looks architecture in the Nara period although it was rebuilt in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 内部には本尊薬師三尊像（重要文化財）を中心に、十二神将像、地蔵菩薩立像（重文）、帝釈天立像（重文）、伎芸天立像（重文）などを安置する。
sen.e: Placed are the principal Buddhist image, Yakushi and two bodhisattvas statues (an important cultural property), Junishinsho statue, Jizo bodhisattva standing statue (an important cultural property), Taishakuten standing statue (an important cultural property), and Gigeiten standing statue (an important cultural property).

Placed are the principal Buddhist image, Yakushi Sanzon-zo (Triad Image of Yakushi Buddha) (an important cultural property), Junishinsho-zo (statue of Twelve Heavenly Generals), standing statue of Jizo Bodhisattva (an important cultural property), standing statue of Taishakuten (an important cultural property), and standing statue of Gigeiten (an important cultural property).
sen.cmt: Yakushi and two bodhisattvas statues > Yakushi Sanzon-zo (Triad Image of Yakushi Buddha)Junishinsho statue > Junishinsho-zo (statue of Twelve Heavenly Generals)Jizo bodhisattva standing statue > standing statue of Jizo BodhisattvaTaishakuten standing statue > standing statue of TaishakutenGigeiten standing statue > standing statue of Gigeiten
sen.e: Placed are the principal Buddhist image, Yakushi Sanzon-zo (Triad Image of Yakushi Buddha) (an important cultural property), Junishinsho-zo (statue of Twelve Heavenly Generals), standing statue of Jizo Bodhisattva (an important cultural property), standing statue of Taishakuten (an important cultural property), and standing statue of Gigeiten (an important cultural property).

sen.e: A national treasure
National Treasure

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: The main hall
The main hall
The main hall

sen.j: －既述。
sen.e: as stated previously.
as stated previously.
as stated previously.

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important cultural property

sen.cmt: 頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: Important Cultural Property

sen.j: 伝・技芸天立像
sen.e: A standing statue known as Gigeiten
A standing statue known as Gigeiten-ryuzo
A standing statue known as Gigeiten-ryuzo

sen.j: －本堂仏壇の向かって左端に立つ。
sen.e: It stands on the observers' left of the Buddhist alter in the main hall.
It stands on the observers' left of the Buddhist alter in the main hall.
It stands on the observers' left of the Buddhist alter in the main hall.

sen.j: 瞑想的な表情と優雅な身のこなしで多くの人を魅了してきた像である。
sen.e: Its meditative facial expression and elegant posture have attracted people.
Its meditative facial expression and elegant posture have attracted people.
Its meditative facial expression and elegant posture have attracted people.

sen.j: 頭部のみが奈良時代の乾漆造、体部は鎌倉時代の木造による補作だが、像全体としては違和感なく調和している。
sen.e: Its head was made with the dry lacquer method in the Nara period while its body was remade of wood in the Kamakura period, but the statue is well-balanced without any feeling of strangeness.
Its head was made with the dry lacquer method in the Nara period while its body was remade of wood in the Kamakura period, but the statue is well-balanced without any feeling of strangeness.
Its head was made with the dry lacquer method in the Nara period while its body was remade of wood in the Kamakura period, but the statue is well-balanced without any feeling of strangeness.

sen.j: 「伎芸天」の彫像の古例は日本では本像以外にほとんどなく、本来の尊名であるかどうかは不明である。
sen.e: Old statues of "Gigeiten" are usually made of wood in Japan and it is not clear whether Gigeiten is a real name of the statue.
This statue is almost only one example of old sculpture of "Gigeiten" in Japan and it is not clear whether Gigeiten is a real name of the statue.
sen.cmt: 「本像」が「木像」として訳されているのようなので、「本像」として直しました。
sen.e: This statue is almost only one example of old sculpture of "Gigeiten" in Japan and it is not clear whether Gigeiten is a real name of the statue.

sen.j: なお、秋篠寺にはこの像と同様に、頭部は奈良時代の乾漆造、体部は鎌倉時代の木造の像があと3体ある。
sen.e: Akishinodera has three more statues whose heads were made with the dry lacquer method in the Nara period and whose bodies were made of wood in the Kamakura period.
Akishino-dera Temple has three more statues whose heads were made with the dry lacquer method in the Nara period and whose bodies were made of wood in the Kamakura period.
Akishino-dera Temple has three more statues whose heads were made with the dry lacquer method in the Nara period and whose bodies were made of wood in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 薬師三尊像
sen.e: Yakushi sanzon statue
Yakushi Sanzon-zo
Yakushi Sanzon-zo

sen.j: －本堂の本尊である。
sen.e: It is the principal image in the main hall.
It is the principal image in the main hall.
It is the principal image in the main hall.

sen.j: 中尊の薬師如来が素木仕上げであるのに対し、脇侍の日光・月光（がっこう）菩薩像は彩色仕上げで作風も異なり、本来の一具ではないと思われるがいずれも平安時代の作とされる（中尊像については鎌倉時代以降の作とする見方もある）。
sen.e: Yakushi Nyorai in the center is a statue made of natural timber while Nikko and Gakko bodhisattvas in both sides are colored statues, and they are not apparently a set of three Buddhist statues as their styles are different, but they all were made in the Heian period (Some says the Buddhist statue in the center was made in the Kamakura period or later).

Yakushi Nyorai in the center is a statue made of natural timber while Nikko and Gakko bodhisattvas in both sides are colored statues, and they are not apparently a set of three Buddhist statues as their styles are different, but they all were made in the Heian period (Some says the Buddhist statue in the center was made in the Kamakura period or later).

Yakushi Nyorai in the center is a statue made of natural timber while Nikko and Gakko bodhisattvas in both sides are colored statues, and they are not apparently a set of three Buddhist statues as their styles are different, but they all were made in the Heian period (Some says the Buddhist statue in the center was made in the Kamakura period or later).

sen.j: 6本の手をもち、体じゅうに蛇が巻き付いた忿怒像で、秋篠寺が真言密教寺院であった時代の作である。
sen.e: It is an angry statue which has six arms and around which snakes are wrapped, and it was made in the time when Akishinodera belonged to the Shingon sect of esoteric Buddhism.

It is a Funnu-zo (the statue of Terrible Countenance) which has six arms and around which snakes are wrapped, and it was made in the time when Akishino-dera Temple belonged to the Shingon sect of esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 秘仏で、6月6日のみ公開される。
